title: A1708 820-00840-A 5V 400ma
message: I found a small amount of corrosion on the usb-c ports. I have cleaned them but the board won't request 20v. I cannot see any damage on the rest of the board. I'm getting 5v 400ma on both sockets. C3100, C3108, C3200, and C3208 are all giving around 3.4v R3000 and R3001 are also giving 3.4v. I'm not sure where to look next. I'm thinking that the socket may be shorted to ground.

title: A1708 820-00840-A 5V 400ma
message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Check voltage and diode mode to ground at all CD3215 LDO rails.
Also check 3V3_G3H and PPBUS_G3H.

title: A1708 820-00840-A 5V 400ma
message:
Thank you :D

U9911 is giving 3.4v on pin 6

DZ9927 is giving 13v on pin 2

title: A1708 820-00840-A 5V 400ma
message:
Voltages look good.
Did you get these values with charger alone, no battery connected?

Don't forget about mentioned LDO rails...

I'm looking at the schematic. How do I identify the LDO rails?

title: A1708 820-00840-A 5V 400ma
message:
Don't use boardview when specify MLB readings.
We need to look at schematic to understand what happens.
You can use the boardview to locate test pints, but PLEASE post schematic refference; signal name, or pin component.

CD3215 chip has 4 LDO rails.
You've specified 1V1 LDO for U3100, but not for U3200.
Also you've missed one 1V8 LDO for U3100.

Do you get 1V1 LDO on both chips?
It will apear only on the powered port!

Look at USB-C redriver chip if not burnt.
It doesn't appear on schematic, nor boardview; placed on the other board side, opposite to CD3215 chips.

title: A1708 820-00840-A 5V 400ma
message:
Okay. I think I understand. I'll do that. Thank you.

PP1V8_UPC_XA_LDOA gives 1.78V

The readings I'm getting on diode mode fluctuate wildly. On that test pad I'm getting 1.5 MΩ and climbs. Some of the others went from their initial reading to the same thing. I'm not very familiar with this way of testing for a short to ground so I don't know if i'm doing the right thing.

title: A1708 820-00840-A 5V 400ma
message:
PVP1V1_UPC_XB_LDO
_BMC gives 1.1v when I have power connected to one usb-c but no volts when connected to the other.

And now I just realised that

title: A1708 820-00840-A 5V 400ma
message:
You can't get K/M ohm values in diode mode.
Multimeter will show "V" when switched to diode mode.
However, do not post the "V" for diode mode readings; avoid misunderstoods.

Read this thread for more information:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/how-to-collection.60974/[/URL]

One USB port is damaged.
You should compare (proper) diode mode readings between both ports (on the same pins).

Sorry. I am still learning. Can I use FlexBV to find a trace and, if so, what can I determine with this?

title: A1708 820-00840-A 5V 400ma
message:
Boardview and schematic don't show USB-C port terminals.
You must find corresponding points in the MLB, checking continuity from J3300 to USB-C terminals.
You will need good board to find the traces; the bad one doesn't have continuity.
If broken traces are not in MLB (or bad solders at J3300), then need to change the USB port...

title: A1708 820-00840-A 5V 400ma
message: At this point do you think there is any problem with the CD3215 chips?

title: A1708 820-00840-A 5V 400ma
message:
You have broken trace for sure.
You must get the same readings on diode mode at USB-C terminals like good board.

title: A1708 820-00840-A 5V 400ma
message: To do that I take off the usbc plate from the opposite of CD3215 side?

title: A1708 820-00840-A 5V 400ma
message:
Need to do that to get acces to the pins.
In case, the same pins do not have another available test points on their traces.

title: A1708 820-00840-A 5V 400ma
message:
Do you get 3V3_S5G?
Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for pulse at PM_SLP_S5_L.

and no pulse.

title: A1708 820-00840-A 5V 400ma
message:
Did you check at same time when trigger SMC_ONOFF_L?
Do the same for PM_PWRBTN_L; should catch a drop pulse there.

title: A1708 820-00840-A 5V 400ma
message:
I don't know if i'm doing something wrong.

PM_SLP_S5_L is permanently 0v while shorting both SMC_ONOFF_L and PM_PWRBTN_L to ground.

title: A1708 820-00840-A 5V 400ma
message:
SMC must send drop pulse to PCH, when trigger SMC_ONOFF_L.
If you detect such drop pulse (PM_PWRBTN_L), then the problem is on PCH side.

title: A1708 820-00840-A 5V 400ma
message:
PM_PWRBTN_L starts at 3.31v drops immediately to 0.34v then back to 3.31v
PM_SLP_S5_L starts at 0v and does not change after trigger.

PCH should react to power button.

title: A1708 820-00840-A 5V 400ma
message: When you say PCH you mean PM_SLP_S5_L specifically?

title: A1708 820-00840-A 5V 400ma
message:
"PM_PWRBTN_L starts at 3.31v drops immediately to 0.34v then back to 3.31v"
All PM_SLP_Sx_L signals should pulse at same tyime.
If not, the problem is PCH related.
Be sure PM_RSMRST_L is steady high.

Check R7807/47.

title: A1708 820-00840-A 5V 400ma
message:
"When I remove U8205 from the donor board, is there a way to test that it is good before installing?"
When I don't quote something, the reply is for your previous post.

If enable signal still low after removing U8205, then the chip doesn't cause the problem; so U8205 should be good.
